$description: Semantic color tokens for the light theme. These tokens provide MEANING-based color usage rather than raw color values. RULE: Always use semantic tokens in components, not primitive palette colors. Semantic tokens ensure consistent color usage across the UI and enable theming. The light theme uses dark text on light backgrounds for optimal readability.

borderWidth.$description: Border thickness scale. Pixel units for crisp 1px borders at all zoom levels. Match border weight to element importance: thin for subtle, thick for emphasis. Most UI borders use 'thin' (1px).

borderStyle.$description: Border stroke patterns. Most UI uses solid borders. Dashed/dotted for special states or decorative purposes.

dark.$description: Neutral dark scale (10 shades). Primary use: dark theme backgrounds, surfaces, and UI chrome. Cool-neutral undertone pairs well with blue primary. Shade 6-7 recommended for dark theme body backgrounds. Shade 0-2 for text on dark backgrounds.

gray.$description: Neutral gray scale (10 shades). Primary use: borders, dividers, disabled states, secondary text. True neutral - no warm/cool bias. Use for UI chrome that shouldn't draw attention. Shade 6 meets WCAG AA for normal text on white.

red.$description: Red scale (10 shades). Semantic meaning: error, danger, destructive actions, validation failures. Use shade 6-7 for error text (meets WCAG AA on white). Shade 0-1 for error backgrounds. Never use red alone for errors - always pair with icon/text for colorblind users.

pink.$description: Pink scale (10 shades). Decorative accent color - no semantic meaning. Use for: marketing highlights, gender-neutral decorative elements, badges, tags. Pairs well with violet and grape for creative contexts.

grape.$description: Grape/purple scale (10 shades). Decorative accent - suggests creativity, premium, or special content. Use for: premium features, creative tools, user-generated content highlights. Distinct from violet (more magenta).

violet.$description: Violet scale (10 shades). Decorative accent - suggests innovation, technology, or special features. Use for: feature highlights, beta features, innovation areas. More blue-shifted than grape.

indigo.$description: Indigo scale (10 shades). Decorative accent between blue and violet. Use for: alternative primary actions, secondary navigation, complementary to blue primary. More formal than violet.

blue.$description: Blue scale (10 shades). PRIMARY BRAND COLOR - use for primary actions, links, focus states, selected items. This is the ClearCo brand blue. Shade 6 is the primary interactive color. Shade 4 for dark theme. Always ensure 4.5:1 contrast ratio for interactive elements.

cyan.$description: Cyan scale (10 shades). Decorative accent - suggests freshness, clarity, or water-related concepts. Use for: informational highlights, data visualization, alternative to blue when blue has semantic meaning.

teal.$description: Teal scale (10 shades). Decorative accent between cyan and green. Use for: secondary success states, nature/environmental contexts, wellness features, data visualization.

green.$description: Green scale (10 shades). Semantic meaning: success, positive actions, completion, online status, growth. Use shade 6-7 for success text (WCAG AA on white). Shade 0-1 for success backgrounds. Always pair with icon/text for colorblind accessibility.

lime.$description: Lime scale (10 shades). Decorative accent - suggests freshness, nature, or organic concepts. Use for: environmental features, growth indicators, seasonal promotions. Higher visibility than green.

yellow.$description: Yellow scale (10 shades). Semantic meaning: warning, caution, pending states, attention needed. ACCESSIBILITY NOTE: Yellow has poor contrast - never use yellow text on white. Use shade 7-9 for text. Shade 0-2 for warning backgrounds with dark text.

orange.$description: Orange scale (10 shades). Decorative accent - suggests energy, warmth, or urgency (softer than red). Use for: promotional content, CTAs that shouldn't be red, secondary warnings, seasonal themes.

color.$description: All semantic color assignments. Organized by: text colors, background colors, interactive states, status colors. Each semantic token references a primitive color from the palette. Use semantic names in code for maintainability and theme support.

primary.$description: Primary brand color variants (blue in ClearCo theme). Use primary colors for: main CTAs, selected states, active navigation, brand emphasis. The primary color establishes brand identity and draws attention to key actions. Includes: filled (solid backgrounds), light (subtle backgrounds), contrast (text on primary), and full shade scale (0-9).

height.$description: Button height values mapped from sizing primitives.

fontSize.$description: Button font sizes for each size variant.

height.$description: Input height values mapped from sizing primitives.

fontSize.$description: Input font sizes for each size variant. Use md (16px) minimum for accessibility.

breakpoints.$description: Viewport width breakpoints for media queries. Use mobile-first approach: base styles for mobile, then layer on complexity at larger breakpoints. Values in em units = px/16. USAGE: @media (min-width: TOKEN_VALUE) for progressive enhancement.

contentWidth.$description: Maximum content width constraints for readability and layout control. Apply as max-width on content containers. Prevents content from stretching uncomfortably wide on large screens.

radius.$description: Border radius scale from subtle to fully rounded. Values are rem-based for accessibility (scale with user font preferences). Choose radius based on component size and context - not arbitrary aesthetics.

input.$description: Standard heights for input fields and form controls. Matches Mantine's input size scale.

button.$description: Standard heights for button elements. Aligns with input heights for form consistency.

icon.$description: Standard sizes for icon elements. Use these to ensure icons are appropriately sized relative to text and other elements.

spacing.$description: Component-level spacing scale for padding, margins, and gaps. Follows a non-linear scale optimized for common UI patterns. Use xs-sm for tight/compact UIs, md for default spacing, lg-xl for breathing room and section separation.

gridSpacing.$description: Grid and layout gutter spacing based on 8px grid. Use for CSS Grid gap, Flexbox gap, and multi-column layout gutters. Pixel values for precise grid alignment. All values are multiples of 8px.

verticalRhythm.$description: Baseline-aligned spacing for vertical rhythm in typography-heavy layouts. Based on 1.6rem (25.6px) baseline. Use for consistent vertical spacing in prose content, documentation, and text-heavy interfaces. Maintains readable flow in long-form content.

shadow.$description: Box-shadow scale from subtle to dramatic. Each shadow uses multiple layers for natural appearance. Elevation implies interaction priority: higher = more important/interactive. Rem units for blur/spread scale with font size. Choose shadow based on element's conceptual height above the page.

focus.$description: Focus ring configuration for consistent, accessible focus indicators across all interactive elements.

ring.$description: Focus ring appearance. Uses outline (not border) to avoid layout shifts. Combines width, offset, and color for visibility against any background.

zIndex.$description: Stacking layer scale for managing element overlap. Layers are separated by 100 to allow intermediate values. Order represents visual priority: base (bottom) â†’ tooltip (top). Elements should stay within their designated layer range.

duration.$description: Animation timing scale from instant to slow. Match duration to element size and travel distance: small/close = fast, large/far = slow. User perception: <100ms feels instant, 100-300ms feels responsive, >500ms feels sluggish. Always combine with appropriate easing.

easing.$description: Cubic-bezier easing curves for CSS transitions and animations. Values are [x1, y1, x2, y2] control points. Each curve creates different motion character. Match easing to animation intent: ease-out for entrances, ease-in for exits, ease-in-out for transformations.

fontFamily.heading: 'Atkinson Hyperlegible Next', 'Atkinson Hyperlegible', 'Public Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif
fontFamily.mono: ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, 'Liberation Mono', 'Courier New', monospace

fontSize.$description: Type scale from small helper text to large display headings. Use semantic names (xs, sm, md) rather than pixel values. Pair font sizes with appropriate line heights for optimal readability. ACCESSIBILITY: Never set font-size below xs (12px) for any readable content.

fontWeight.$description: Font weight scale from light to bold. Numeric values follow CSS font-weight specification (100-900). Ensure the font family supports the weight - unsupported weights will be approximated by the browser, often poorly. Open Sans includes all weights below.

lineHeight.$description: Line height scale from tight (display) to loose (prose). Match line height to content type: tighter for headings, looser for body text. RULE: Longer line lengths need more line height. Use xs-sm only for headings/buttons, md-xl for readable content.

opacity.$description: Opacity scale from 0 (invisible) to 1 (solid). Values 0-100 represent percentages. Use semantic names (disabled, overlay) when purpose is clear. Numeric values for precise control. Combine with background colors for overlay effects.

zIndex.$description: Mantine z-index layers using kebab-case naming convention
